array.string: Napoleon Bonaparte is appointed Commander-in-Chief of the Armies of the French Republic.
Napoleon becomes first consul of France.
Napoleon's coup d’état that overthrew the system of government under the Directory in France and substituted the Consulate, making way for the despotism of Napoleon Bonaparte.
Napoleon defeats the Austrians at the Battle of Marengo and re-conquers Italy.

Near the end of the day, the French overcame Gen. Michael von Melas's surprise attack, driving the Austrians out of Italy and consolidating Napoleon's political position in Paris as First Consul of France.
Napoleon crowned first emperor of France.

Napoleon wanted to establish the legitimacy of his imperial reign, with its new royal family and new nobility. To this end, he designed a new coronation ceremony which had emphasized the king's consecration (sacre) and anointment.
Napoleon is crowned King of Italy.
Napoleon I was crowned at the Duomo di Milano, Milan with the Iron Crown of Lombardy. His title was "Emperor of the French and King of Italy", showing the importance of this Italian Kingdom for him.
Napoleon defeats Russians and Austrians at Austerlitz.

Battle of Austerlitz, also called Battle of the Three Emperors, the first engagement of the War of the Third Coalition and one of Napoleon's greatest victories. His 68,000 troops defeated almost 90,000 Russians and Austrians.
